member.name: M:IntelliFactory.JavaScript.Core.Optimize(IntelliFactory.JavaScript.Core.Expression)
member.summary: Performs an optimization pass. Current optimizations include local tail-call elimination that transforms LetRecursive nodes to loops. The complexity is bounded by O(n) in the number of sub-expressions.

member.summary: Maps over the immediate sub-expressions. Expression forms that bind variables are transformed by inserting Lambda, so that Lambda is the only variable-binding form.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.JavaScript.Core
member.summary:
Defines a reduced language that is suitable for simple optimization, and efficient compilation to JavaScript.
The goal of Core is to define a JavaScript-like language satisfying the following criteria:
(1) Has tractable semantics to simplify optimization.
(2) Is rich enough to express JavaScript efficiently.
(3) Can be read from a JavaScript subset and elaborated to JavaScript with minimal loss of structure.
Expanding all JavaScript programs into Core has not been a design goal, therefore certain constructs, such as mutable variables and break statements have been removed for simplicity.
